08:54 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:02 <DarkKnightCZ> XWikiAttachment.setComment(String) is safe way of setting custom "sign" to attachment, right? (and it needs re-saving the attachment)  
09:03 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:05 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:10 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:18 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <sburjan> tmortagne, Denis: good morning. I am still able to reproduce XWIKI-9822. Also I have this on another dev server. How can I help you to reproduce it ?  
09:38 <Denis> sburjan: we definitely do not find the difference between your test environment and ours, it could be a matter of thread synchronization that only happen in some hardware or os conditions, could your test server be accessible ?  
09:39 <sburjan> it's a server I can't destroy, so I'll have to give you access to my machine  
10:12 <spawn57> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <spawn57> hi  
10:12 <spawn57> is it possible to create a button in an xwiki page to interact with a velocity script?  
10:14 <DarkKnightCZ> spawn57: button is client-sided element, so you have to use ajax (or form)  
10:20 <spawn57> form sounds better for now.  
10:21 <vmassol> yes form works well for this  
10:21 <DarkKnightCZ> yep... it depends whenever you need to preserve current page (ajax) or not (form)  
10:21 <vmassol> use the html macro and the html <form> element  
10:21 <spawn57> I want to make a button that will create a new page and add content to it.  I'm wrote the part that create a new page and generate the content.  I just want to be able to allow the user to specifyc the page name.  
10:22 <vmassol> have the action of the form call the same page (ie empty action)  
10:22 <vmassol> then in a {{velocity}} macro on the page check the passed parameters  
10:22 <vmassol> and if not empty do whatever you wish  
10:22 <DarkKnightCZ> yes, then form is the best  
10:22 <vmassol> there are plenty of examples around  
10:23 <vmassol> for ex: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/References/WebHome  
10:23 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/References/WebHome?viewer=code  
10:23 <spawn57> oh, perfect  
10:23 <spawn57> thanks guy  
10:23 <spawn57> guys  
10:24 <DarkKnightCZ> no problem  
10:24 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <DarkKnightCZ> tmortagne: hi, is it safe to suspend Job thread? (i need to queue part of code if there are multiple jobs, so far i figured out something like "if queue not empty, wait(), after completing the code, if queue not empty, next.notify()", which works with normal threading)  
10:37 <tmortagne> DarkKnightCZ: suspending job should not cause any issue for the generic part no  
10:38 <DarkKnightCZ> ok, perfect

12:25 <tmortagne> any idea what produces http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/lastBuild/testReport/ ?  
12:25 <gdelhumeau> hi tmortagne  
12:25 <gdelhumeau> I was looking at it  
12:25 <tmortagne> ok thanks  
12:30 <gdelhumeau> I have fixed one yesterday  
12:30 <gdelhumeau> Now I look for the 3 others  
12:30 <tmortagne> yep, seen it

13:06 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: this pull request is about the build  
13:14 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
13:15 <andreeapopescu> Hello devs! Can please someone release on Jira the File Manager Application: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/FILEMAN#selectedTab=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.project%3Aversions-panel. I would need version 1.1.2.  
13:31 <Kaisen> has joined #xwiki  
14:11 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:11 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: applied  
14:14 <tmortagne> andreeapopescu: you should have the right to do it yourself now  
14:15 <andreeapopescu> tmortagne: thank you  
14:16 <Denis> Kaisen: You should be interested that we have open XWIKI-9822 and that I have diagnose it now, about to comment on the issue  
14:17 <Denis> Kaisen: Could you confirm you were in the same situation ?  
14:40 <andreeapopescu> tmortagne: ping  
14:40 <tmortagne> andreeapopescu: pong  
14:41 <andreeapopescu> tmortagne: I have just released a new version of File Manager Application, but clicking the refresh button from the extensions page does not update it  
14:43 <tmortagne> try again  
14:44 <andreeapopescu> tmortagne: ok. thanks  
14:44 <tmortagne> looks like AETHER keep maven metadata in cache for some time and here you did two releases in a short time  
14:44 <tmortagne> I need to look at it as soon as I get some time...

17:17 <Emenems> has joined #xwiki  
17:18 <Emenems> Bonjour  
17:19 <Emenems> Hello. Should english be the language here ?  
17:19 <vmassol> hi  
17:19 <vmassol> yes  
17:20 <Emenems> So, I'm trying and discovering xwiki (under a debian installation). I already like the tool, althought i need to customise it. Is there a way (native or via plugins) to add a "navigation tree", but dynamic, so that when users add a page, it appears directly in the tree.  
17:20 <Emenems> ?  
17:25 <vmassol> Emenems: check http://extensions.xwiki.org you should be able to find several extensions there for your needs  
17:28 <Emenems> vmassol, ok great. Ah, in "Administration » Extension Manager » Add extensions" I see that i can directly install extensions. Is this the same repository as extensions.xwiki.org ?  
17:29 <vmassol> yes almost  
17:29 <vmassol> some extensions cannot be installed with the Extension Manager  
17:29 <vmassol> they have specific instructions in this case  
17:29 <vmassol> for example code snippets  
17:30 <vmassol> when you see "installable with extension manager" it means it can be installed directly from your wiki using the Extension Manager  
17:32 <Emenems> ok great.  
17:33 <gdelhumeau> guys, can we commit today or are we waiting for the release of M1?  
17:35 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: depends if your commit is dangerous or not  
17:35 <tmortagne> the release won't happen today and not sure about the time I will have tomorrow  
17:36 <gdelhumeau> my commit is about moving XWikiAllGroup to xwiki-enterprise instead of having it in administration-ui  
17:36 <gdelhumeau> and the same for XWikiAdminGroup  
17:39 <gdelhumeau> I don't understand why xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards still fails  
17:39 <gdelhumeau> It is like my last pull request was not taken into account  
17:47 <cjd> has quit  
17:54 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: does not sounds like something very dangerous (you move it to xwiki-enterprise-ui-admin-user, right ?)  
17:55 <gdelhumeau> yes  
17:55 <tmortagne> just hopping no UI test in platform depends on the fact that XWikiAllGroups exist  
17:56 <tmortagne> we really need to make XWikiAllGroups a virtual group all the time  
17:59 <gdelhumeau> ok, done  
18:01 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: admin app is finally almost an app now, only thing remaining is XWikiPreferences :)  
18:01 <gdelhumeau> good

23:23 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> I have the converter on and and it works  
23:23 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> but I don't know where to change the content of this getTextArea method
